pages.title: Role and function of the media

elements.name: question1

rows.text: Because the media have a major influence on opinion-forming, they are also referred to as the fourth estate.
rows.value: Because the media have a major influence on opinion-forming, they are also referred to as the fourth estate.

rows: In addition to traditional mass media such as newspapers, radio and television, social media play a particularly important role today.
The Swiss government is allowed to dictate to the media what they must and must not report on; censorship is permitted.
In Switzerland, it is a guaranteed right that every person may receive information freely.
The Swiss media also have the task of critically monitoring and reporting on the private lives of politicians.

elements.name: question5
rows: The diversity of the Swiss media landscape is an advantage when it comes to forming opinions.
The abbreviation SRG stands for Swiss Broadcasting Corporation.

rows.text: SRG SSR is a public service broadcaster and is primarily financed by fees.
rows.value: SRG SSR is a public service broadcaster and is primarily financed by fees.

rows: Every person aged 18 and over living in Switzerland must pay the annual fee for radio and television reception.
The so-called public service mandate means that SRG SSR must provide the whole country with information.

elements.name: question7
rows: In addition to the public SRG SSR, there are only two private media companies in Switzerland.
Private media companies receive part of the SRG-SSR fees in the form of subsidies.

rows.text: Since private media companies earn their money primarily through advertising, there is a risk that important advertising customers will try to influence reporting.
rows.value: Since private media companies earn their money primarily through advertising, there is a risk that important advertising customers will try to influence reporting.

rows: Media professionals have numerous means at their disposal to influence the formation of opinion. These include the selection of topics and the setting of headlines.
Images cannot be manipulated because they always show reality.
